disease.name: Powdery mildew
disease.symptons: It appears as small, white, powdery patches on young parts of stems, leaves and buds which increases in size, and coalesce to cover entire area of leaf surface.
disease.spread: Fungus can survive in plant debris

disease.name: Wilt
disease.symptons: The disease can easily be recognized in the field by drooping of the terminal portions
disease.spread: The disease is soil borne and primary infection occurs through inoculum present in the soil.

disease.name: stem gall
disease.symptons: The disease appears in the form of tumor-like swellings of leafStem gallveins, leaf stalks, peduncles, stems as well as fruits.
disease.spread: The disease is soil borne and the inocula present in the soil are the source of primary infection

disease.name: Blight disease
disease.symptons: Dark brown spots appear on the stem and leaves of infected plants and emerging umbels with young flowers get killed.
disease.spread: The pathogen survives through conidia or mycelia in diseased plant debris or weed or in soil.
